client.data

Class RunningGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.data.RunningGame

  • public class RunningGame
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds all the informations about a Game the input comes from the Clientparser which will simultaneous fire an Event, so the GUI redraws / rebuilds with informations from here. Everything in here is static, so it is accessible from everywhere without problems.
    Author:
    f0x918

    • Method Detail

      • setBuildTime

        public static void setBuildTime(int seconds)
        Sets the Build time of the running game. if the Build time is over 0 the game changes in the state BUILD. Then a timer is started which decreases the build time until it reaches 0; Otherwise the state is changed to ANIM.
        Parameters:
        seconds - how long the next phase is.

      • getBuildTime

        public static int getBuildTime()
        this method returns the remaining build time.
        Returns:
        how long the remaining Build time is.

      • setAnim

        public static void setAnim(int seconds)
        Sets the Animation time until the next round. if seconds is smaller than 0 nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        seconds - how long the animation phase is.

      • getAnimTime

        public static int getAnimTime()
        this method returns the remaining animation time.
        Returns:
        how long the remaining Anim time is.

      • stopTimer

        static void stopTimer()
        clears the existing timer.

      • startTimer

        static void startTimer()
        starts a Timer and counts down the remaining time. Note that after the Build phase the client goes automatically to the Anim phase. But not from the Anim Phase automatically to the Build phase.

      • setPaused

        public static void setPaused(boolean b)
        set if a game is paused or not.
        Parameters:
        b - is it paused or not?

      • getGamePhase

        public static GamePhases getGamePhase()
        return the Phase the game is in.
        Returns:
        state the phase the game is in.

      • initGame

        public static void initGame(int gId,
            int fId)
        starts a new game. Sets the GameId and the field which the player has.
        Parameters:
        gId - the Game id of this game
        fId - on which field this player is

      • softReset

        public static void softReset()
        this method clears all the fields in this class. is used at the end of a game, so everything is ready for a new game.

      • hardReset

        public static void hardReset()
        this method clears all the fields in this class. is used at the end of a game, so everything is ready for a new game.

      • updateObj

        public static void updateObj(Protocol objectType,
             int xCoords,
             int yCoords,
             int objectId,
             int playerId,
             int health)
        creates an object if it doesn't exist, otherwise an existing object will be updated.
        Parameters:
        objectType - the type of the object
        xCoords - new x Coordinates
        yCoords - new y Coordinates
        playerId - the player Id
        objectId - the id of this object
        health - the new health of this object

        Parameters:
        objectId - the id of the object

        set my population.
        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public static int getMyFieldId()
        returns the field id of the given Player.
        Returns:

      • resetObjectLocations

        private static void resetObjectLocations()
        resets the oldLocation of all GameObjects. this is to tell them that a new round has begun and the objects have not been moved since.

      • getPlayerColor

        public static java.awt.Color getPlayerColor(int playerId)
        returns the color for a player. (Always the same Color for the same Player)
        Parameters:
        playerId - the if of the player.
